meaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> rolls in and destroys all the <radical>construction</radical> that was being done on the <kanji>inlet</kanji> and the <kanji>bay</kanji>. Both the inlet and the bay were having a lot of construction done on them to repair the damage from the last tsunami, and then another tsunami rolled in and destroyed all that too. Bummer.
readingMnemonic: Imagine the Japanese people standing on the <kanji>bay</kanji> and the <kanji>inlet</kanji> as the tsunami approaches. “<reading>Eh</reading> (え)? What is that, Akiko?” “Eh? Where? Oh gawd, it’s a tsunami!!”
